riddle: It brings back the lost as though never gone, shines laughter and tears with light long since shone; a moment to make, a lifetime to shed; valued then but lost when your dead. What Is It?
What do you get when you cross a fish with an elephant?

I can be long, or I can be short.
I can be grown, and I can be bought.
I can be painted, or left bare.
I can be round, or I can be square.
What am I?
I am lighter than a feather yet no man can hold me for long.
What occurs once in every minute, twice in every moment and yet never in a thousand years?
What animal is best at hitting a baseball?
What do you call a cow that twitches?
